main event: Multiple sightings of unidentified objects over Worcester, Massachusetts on April 22, 1957.
interesting points: The sighting included a single dust-red object overhead, observed for 7 seconds., Seven silver objects were seen in a straight line, also for about 7 seconds., Approximately twenty minutes later, a 'V' formation of unidentified objects was reported, which dropped altitude., Total sightings were reported within a time frame of 5 minutes., Witnesses were observers at Holy Cross College and included a private major and a future Naval Reserve member.
sighted object: Unidentified flying objects, including a dust-red object and several silver objects.
witness description: Observers at Holy Cross College, Worcester, Massachusetts.
